body:
# PR Summary

Replace Ambiguous language for pester tests.
Pester tests for Remove-Item used incorrect terminology using switch analogous with Parameter

## PR Context

Modify incorrect terminology, to use `parameter` instead of `switch`.

comments.author: romero126
comments.body:
Hey Sean, I thought the same thing at first. However after looking deeply at the terminology. I decided the term "argument" would be better. Because "parameter" is the "-value" or $variable that gets defined when the argument is passed into the command. https://www.quora.com/What-is-the-difference-between-argument-and-parameters-in-C Is there an official consensus that the PowerShell team uses over the conventional comp sci answer?
Quora
What is the difference between argument and parameters in C?
Answer (1 of 8): A parameter is a variable in a method definition. When a method is called, the arguments are the data you pass into the method's parameters. Parameter is variable in the declaration of function. Argument is the actual value of this variable that gets passed to function.

comments.author: sdwheeler
comments.body: @romero126 In PowerShell and in this example `-Path` is the parameter being tested `$testfilepath` is the argument value being passed.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I agree with @sdwheeler here.  `Switch` is definitely wrong.  Reading the name of the test, it's referring to the `Path parameter`.

comments.author: romero126
comments.body: Thank you @sdwheeler and @SteveL-MSFT for the feedback. I would have replied sooner but I got a little busy.
